name: Poppin Soda
description: This website was my senior project at BYU-I.  The project is a mock of a soda company website.  The goal of this project was to learn something I have never done up to that point in my schooling. Even though I worked on some web projects with Angular and PHP, I wanted to learn React because I saw how widely it was used in the industry.  To accomplish this, I found a course online through UDEMY and started learning React a month before even beginning my project. This site kickstarted my love of building applications in React.  With this site I explored various third-party libraries and built things into the site like a shopping cart modal and a review section using Material UI.  Since my class, I have gone back to try and refine the site by updating it to Vite and adding things like Prop-types to help root out bugs that were troubling the site.  The site is currently live and open to experiment with.

name: Style Stage
description: Welcome to the Style stage project!  This website was a team project. The project was the result of a challenge to style a web page and style it without touching the HTML or using JavaScript. I specifically made the header, footer and nav bar of the page. I also made the bottom part of the page with the three cards and the various buttons around it. Other parts of the page were made by my fellow teammates. This project taught me the power CSS can have on a website and helped me improve my skills of using various CSS selectors, layout tools, and creativity to get the web page to look according to the team’s designs.

name: BYUI Rebuild
description: Welcome to the BYU-I rebuild project.  This project aimed to recreate the BYU-I home page as much as possible. The project primarily focused on using CSS for styling and structuring HTML correctly on a web page, without involving JavaScript.  I had access to some of BYUI’s fonts, colors, content, and icons to help get the look and feel just right.  This mock site is based off what the BYU-I site looked like as of April 2023. The header and the footer of the page were either simplified or excluded due to the amount of time I had to work on this project.

name: Weather App
description: This project is a simple Five Day Weather forecast of three different cities. The purpose of this site was to practice applying various topics in JavaScript that I learned from some web development classes. These topics include fetching and using a JSON file from an API, storing and using information with local storage, and using JavaScript Objects.

name: Chess
description: This chess project was one that I did in a team. The goal was to make a fully functional chess program. This program needed to follow all the rules of chess, meaning, every piece moves exactly as it could in the real game. We also implemented special moves like castling, empassant, and promotion (though in this version you always promote to a queen). Most of the code we wrote was our own. The code that was not ours was the interact and Open GL Classes and libraries. Those were written by James Helfrich, a professor at BYU-I.

name: Orbit Simulator
description: This project is a simulation of satellites orbiting the earth.  This program allows you to fly a ship and destroy floating junk in space.  If a satellite breaks during the game, then it is the players job to go and destroy it before anything else breaks.  This program uses basic physics.  The orbiting of the satellites is not as precise as it could be since we are using simple Algebra and Geometry, but it is close enough that it looks almost like the real thing.

name: PHP Motors
description: This project is a mockup of a car dealership like website.  On this website, I practiced and implemented several key features. Users can browse through different cars available for purchase, log in to view their account information, and log out. Additionally, a search feature was also implemented that allows users to find specific vehicles. The website is built using the MVC (Model-View-Controller) architecture and utilizes a relational database that I quired using MYSQL.

name: C# ATM
description: Before this project, I knew little about C#.  So I decided to do a simple two week sprint and begin learning the C# language.  I chose to do a simple ATM project so I can work on practicing how to use classes, control flow, loops, and the list container.  To display everything, I chose to do it in the console so I could mainly focus on learning C#.  Since my two week sprint, I have taken two C# courses on Udemy to learn the fundementals C# better.  Those fundementals include variables, functions, classes, etc.
